security_audit.summary: This is a regulatory compliance knowledge-base skill for EU MDR 2017/745 guidance. All static findings are false positives triggered by regulatory terminology (MDR, Class I/II/III) being misinterpreted as security patterns. The skill contains only documentation and placeholder files with no executable malicious code, network calls, or data exfiltration.

content.user_title: Navigate EU MDR medical device compliance
content.value_statement: Medical device manufacturers struggle with complex EU MDR 2017/745 requirements for technical documentation, clinical evidence, and post-market surveillance. This skill provides expert regulatory guidance for classification decisions, compliance gap analysis, and Notified Body interactions.
actual_capabilities: Guide device classification under MDR Annex VIII rules
Assess technical documentation requirements per Annex II and III
Evaluate clinical evidence and PMCF requirements per Annex XIV
Implement UDI system and EUDAMED registration
Develop post-market surveillance plans and PSUR reports
Navigate Notified Body selection and audit preparation
limitations: Does not provide legal advice or regulatory certification
Cannot access real-time EUDAMED database or Notified Body status
Does not replace qualified regulatory affairs professionals for final submissions

use_cases.title: Classify medical devices accurately
use_cases.description: Determine correct device class and conformity assessment route for MDR compliance strategy planning.

use_cases.title: Prepare technical files
use_cases.description: Structure Annex II and III documentation and identify gaps in existing quality management system.

use_cases.title: Plan MDR compliance roadmap
use_cases.description: Develop phased transition strategy from legacy directives to full MDR compliance requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Device classification
prompt_templates.scenario: Determining MDR class for a new device
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a device type description. How should I classify it under MDR Annex VIII? Consider specific device characteristics. What conformity assessment route applies?

prompt_templates.title: Technical documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me structure technical documentation for a Class I, IIa, IIb, or III device. What are the key sections required under Annex II and III?

prompt_templates.title: Clinical evidence
prompt_templates.prompt: What clinical evidence requirements apply to my device type? Should I conduct a clinical investigation or use literature-based evaluation?

prompt_templates.title: Notified Body
prompt_templates.prompt: What should I expect during a Notified Body audit for my device class? How do I prepare technical documentation and personnel?

output_examples.input: How do I classify an insulin pump system under MDR?
output: Device classification: Class IIb (active therapeutic device that administers or exchanges substances)
Classification rules: Rule 11 applies for active therapeutic devices
Conformity assessment route: Notified Body involvement required with Full Quality Management System
Key documentation: Technical file, clinical evaluation report, post-market surveillance plan, UDI registration
Timeline consideration: Engage with Notified Body early due to capacity constraints

output_examples.input: What does my Class I device need for MDR compliance?
output: Class I devices can use self-certification under Annex II
However, sterile devices, measuring devices, or reusable surgical instruments require Notified Body
Technical documentation must include device description, intended purpose, and risk management
Post-market surveillance plan is required with incident reporting procedures
UDI registration in EUDAMED is mandatory for all device classes

output_examples.input: How do I plan clinical evaluation for a legacy device?
output: Start with systematic literature review of existing clinical data
Identify gaps between current evidence and MDR requirements
Determine if equivalence to predicate devices is sufficiently demonstrated
Develop PMCF plan to address any remaining evidence gaps
Update clinical evaluation report at least every 5 years for higher risk devices

best_practices: Start classification discussions with your Notified Body early to avoid reclassification delays
Maintain clinical evidence throughout device lifecycle, not just for initial CE marking
Document all decisions and rationale for regulatory compliance and audit trail purposes
anti_patterns: Assuming legacy MDD certification automatically transitions to MDR without gap analysis
Delaying UDI implementation until after CE marking is obtained
Using clinical data from outdated or irrelevant studies without proper equivalence justification

faq.question: Does this skill work with both new and existing medical devices?
faq.answer: Yes. It covers requirements for new device approvals and transition planning for legacy devices under MDR.

faq.question: What device classes does this skill cover?
faq.answer: All four MDR classes: Class I, IIa, IIb, and III with specific guidance for each classification level.

faq.question: Can this skill help with EUDAMED registration?
faq.answer: It provides guidance on registration requirements and process but cannot access or submit to the EUDAMED database.

faq.question: Is this skill a replacement for a regulatory consultant?
faq.answer: No. It provides expert guidance but should complement, not replace, qualified regulatory affairs professionals.

faq.question: Does the skill include PMCF plan templates?
faq.answer: The skill provides framework guidance for PMCF plan development based on Annex XIV Part B requirements.

faq.question: How does this compare to MDD 93/42/EEC?
faq.answer: The skill explains key differences including expanded clinical evidence requirements and stricter post-market obligations.
